body_html: @boche, yeah, you are right that CudnnLSTM doesn't have a shape known at static time, which is required by AdamOptimizer. As CuDNN manages the internal storage structure for weight and bias parameters, this shape is hardware-and-CuDNN dependent and only available at runtime. I think the solution by @robotnc is a right, natural thing to do, given the this requirement of a known shape by AdamOptimizer, and the fact that it could only be provided at runtime by CuDNN.
